neighbors.name: Babacomari Ranch Company
neighbors.claims: Babacomari Ranch Company is a family-owned enterprise managing the historic Babacomari Ranch, which Frank C. Brophy acquired in 1935 ([alwt.org](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/)). The ranch boundaries follow the original 1832 land grant, and the Brophy family has held stewardship for generations ([babacomariranch.com](https://babacomariranch.com/)). The entity recently applied for and secured a Conditional Use Permit to develop a $40–60 million guest ranch resort on 2,200 acres of the property, known as the Encino Pasture ([patagoniaregionaltimes.org](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-gets-first-permit/)). Family representatives stated the development is intended to provide a revenue stream to keep the ranch intact, noting that some parts of the ranch had previously been sold to satisfy family members seeking liquidity ([patagoniaregionaltimes.org](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-gets-first-permit/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: The entity controls the largest contiguous private land parcel in Arizona (28,000 acres) and is actively engaged in major land-use developments and conservation partnerships.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with the Brophy family leadership regarding their long-term land management goals. Acknowledge their recent resort development permit and frame any potential collaboration as complementary to their stated goal of keeping the ranch intact and economically sustainable.

citations.claim: Frank C. Brophy acquired the ranch in 1935
citations.title: Babacomari Ranch - Arizona Land and Water Trust

citations.claim: Development intended to provide revenue and prevent ranch fragmentation
citations.title: New $40-60 Million Dude Ranch Gets First Permit

neighbors.name: San Ignacio Investments LLC
neighbors.claims: San Ignacio Investments LLC is listed as an entity with property interests in the region, though specific beneficial ownership is not publicly disclosed in available records. A solar project named 'Babacomari Solar' (160 MW) is planned for Cochise County with an expected online date of 2026 ([tep.com](https://www.tep.com/news/teps-largest-battery-system-to-support-customers-through-summer-heat/)). While the project shares the 'Babacomari' name, a direct property link between San Ignacio Investments LLC and the solar developer Clēnera (or its subsidiary Babacomari Solar North LLC) could not be verified in the available public snippets. The solar project entity, Babacomari Solar North LLC, has recently acquired equipment for the project ([pv-magazine-india.com](https://www.pv-magazine-india.com/2025/09/19/meyer-burger-gives-up-on-selling-itself-as-a-whole-sells-u-s-solar-production-tools/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Lack of public profile or verifiable community engagement activity in available records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Verify property ownership and specific relationship to the Babacomari Solar project before formal engagement. Treat as a potential investment vehicle.

citations.claim: Babacomari Solar is a 160 MW project in Cochise County coming online in 2026
citations.title: TEP’s Largest Battery System to Support Customers Through Summer Heat

citations.claim: Babacomari Solar North LLC acquired equipment for the project
citations.title: Meyer Burger sells U.S. solar production tools

neighbors.name: Baker Walker Living Trust
neighbors.claims: No public records regarding this specific trust's activities, stance, or beneficial owners were found in Cochise County public datasets.

neighbors.name: Babacomari Ranch Company LLLP
neighbors.claims: Babacomari Ranch Company LLLP is a limited liability limited partnership associated with the Brophy family, holding title to significant portions of the Babacomari Ranch ([superiorcourt.maricopa.gov](https://www.superiorcourt.maricopa.gov/SuperiorCourt/GeneralStreamAdjudication/docs/schade-sp605ord030112.pdf)). The entity has been an active intervenor in local water rights adjudications, including the San Pedro River Watershed cases ([superiorcourt.maricopa.gov](https://www.superiorcourt.maricopa.gov/SuperiorCourt/GeneralStreamAdjudication/docs/schade-sp605ord030112.pdf)). The ranch has placed over 6,000 acres under conservation easements with the Arizona Land and Water Trust to protect landscape and wildlife corridors ([alwt.org](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/)). Facing economic pressures, the family has pursued development permits for a guest ranch to generate revenue while maintaining the property's integrity ([patagoniaregionaltimes.org](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-gets-first-permit/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major landowner with documented legal involvement in regional water rights and conservation efforts.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a sophisticated stakeholder with significant legal and environmental interests. Highlight alignment with their conservation easements and water resource management goals.

citations.claim: Babacomari Ranch Company LLLP is a limited liability limited partnership intervening in water rights cases
citations.title: Order Granting Motions to Intervene - In re General Adjudication of Gila River System

citations.claim: Placed over 6,000 acres under conservation easements
citations.title: Babacomari Ranch - Arizona Land and Water Trust

citations.claim: Pursued development permits for a guest ranch to generate revenue
citations.title: New $40-60 Million Dude Ranch Gets First Permit
